files.description: Concise root-cause analysis of recurring 'Container lost' failures with concrete remediation steps and verification checklist.
Step-by-step, reproducible local and CI execution instructions (including Docker commands) to run the smoke test reliably.
Single-stage Docker build that pins OS/Python tooling and installs dependencies deterministically for reliable smoke-test execution.
Primary Python dependency list for the project with compatible version ranges suitable for pinning in Docker/CI.
Fully pinned dependency constraint set to ensure deterministic installs and reduce 'container lost' due to resolver/build variability.
Docker ignore rules to minimize build context size and reduce container startup failures due to oversized contexts.
Diagnostic script that captures system/Python/pip versions, checks disk/memory limits, runs a minimal import test, and writes a report under runtime/_build.
Shell wrapper that builds the Docker image, runs the smoke test with resource/timeouts, and saves logs for post-mortem debugging.

missionDescription: Diagnose and fix the recurring 'Container lost' failure observed in CodeExecutionAgent attempts (execution aborted before testing any files). Produce a short `runtime/_build/execution_diagnostics.md` plus updated execution instructions or environment pinning so the smoke test can run reliably.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
Multiple execution attempts aborted, blocking validation of existing scripts (taxonomy validator, artifact gate, meta-analysis).
